document.heading: District of Columbia Business Corporation Act Amendment Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-12, the “District of Columbia Business Corporation Act Amendment Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-236. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 4, 1989 and April 18, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 27, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-28 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: kwiktag ® 103 201 221 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 8-12 "District of Columbia Business Corporation Act Amendment Temporary Act of 1989 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 8-236 on first and second readings, April 4, 1989, and April 18, 1989, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on April 27, 1989, this legislation was assigned Act No. 8-28, published in the May 12, 1989, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 36 page 3371) and transmitted to Congress on May 2, 1989 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(i) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.Co Law 8-12, effective June 6, 1989 DAVID A. CUAR hairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: May 2,3,4,5,8,9,10,11,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,31 June 1,2,5,6,7,8,9,12,13,14,15 12 JUN 6 1989 AN A CT ~U~OZle~ O~R~oal Codification, District of Columbia Code (1989 Supp 9.C. 8 2 8 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA 1989 To amend, on a temporary basis, the District of Columbia Business Corporation Act to provide a uniform annual report fee requirement of foreign and domestic corporations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Business Corporation Act Amendment Temporary Act of 1989 Sec. 2. Section 121 of the District of Columbia Business Corporation Act, approved June 8, 1954 (68 Stat. 228; D.C. Code, sec. 29-399.22 is amended as follows a) By amending subsections (d) and (e) to read as follows d) Each foreign or domestic corporation authorized to do business in the District of Columbia or organized, incorporated, or reincorporated under the provisions of this act sha|l pay an annual report fee of $I00.00, which shall be paid at the time that the annual report, which is required of corporations under the provisions of this chapter, is filed. The provisions of this subsection shall apply to each annual report fee due and payable on April 15, 1989, and each following April 15th e) If the annual report fee of a domestic corporation is unpaid at the time that it is due, interest shall accrue on the annual report fee at the rate of 5% per month until the report fee is paid b) By striking subsections (fi and (g Sec. 3. No late fee or penalty shall be assessed based on the annual report fee due and payable on April 15, 1989. Sec. 4. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as Section 29-399.22 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA Council Period Eight RECORD OF OFFICIAL COUNCIL VOTE DOCKET NO: Bill [3 Item on Consent Calendar ACTION & DATE VOICE VOTE: Recorded vote on request Adopted First Reading, 4-4-89 8-236 Approved, Member Kane and Chairman Clarke voted no Absent: Jarvis [] ROLL CALL VOTE RESULT COUNCIL MEMBER AYE NAY NV.
